Design Proficiency 101


A few people have asked me for advice in regards to the fourth year Electrical Design Proficiency at UNSW. Since an odd 200 people complete the course each year, I though it may be a good idea to create this post. I think this advice should help others completing design proficiency courses at other universities as well too. Keep in mind these are my OPINIONS and my opinions alone. Firstly:
  • The course is quite time consuming, but one of the most useful courses you will do
  • Split into four sections: electronics, signal processing, control systems and an elective topic, thus solidifying your knowledge across previous electrical engineering coursework
  • Each topic consists of a series of tasks in labs which should be approached as lab exams/projects.

Electronics

Signal Processing

Control systems

Elective Topic

The advice for this topic basically stems from the previous. Just make sure you pick a topic you find the most interesting. It will be the topic you most likely will want to spend time on.
